header_summary:
The integration of quantum resistance into Bitcoin through a proposed signature algorithm in the QuBit soft fork addresses potential vulnerabilities posed by quantum computing. This initiative, detailed in a Bitcoin Improvement Proposal ([BIP Draft](https://github.com/cryptoquick/bips/blob/p2qrh/bip-p2qrh.mediawiki)), underscores the importance of proactive measures for Bitcoin's long-term security. It invites community feedback to refine and align the proposal with the Bitcoin network's technical standards and goals.

In parallel, privacy enhancements in Bitcoin transactions are underway, as evidenced by the pre-alpha release of an electrum plugin for the joinstr protocol, leveraging the nostr platform for coinjoin transactions. This development, alongside the proposal to enrich the BIP-39 protocol with a "Free" language for seed mnemonics ([https://github.com/akarve/bip-keychain/blob/main/pre-bips/steganographic-seeds.md](https://github.com/akarve/bip-keychain/blob/main/pre-bips/steganographic-seeds.md)), signals an evolving ecosystem aimed at increasing security, privacy, and versatility. The community is encouraged to engage with these initiatives through review and testing, with detailed information available on GitLab and GitHub.

Additionally, advancements in blockchain data analysis tools, such as the development of a mempool replayer by @willcl-ark and insights into fee estimation from a study comparing the Bitcoind Policy Estimator's modes, reflect a growing interest in understanding and optimizing Bitcoin transaction dynamics. The emergence of JoinMarket with Jam presents a novel, though complex, approach to decentralized transaction management, highlighting the community's pursuit of privacy and decentralization despite existing documentation gaps ([JamDocs](https://jamdocs.org/philosophy/03-joinmarket/)). These developments collectively illustrate the Bitcoin community's commitment to enhancing the network's robustness, privacy, and user experience through technological innovation and collaborative refinement.

recent_posts.title: Should there be a "Network Data" category?
recent_posts.summary:

recent_posts.title: Bitcoind Policy Estimator modes Analysis
recent_posts.summary:
- The study analyzes Bitcoind Policy Estimator's performance in `conservative` and `economical` modes.
- Findings highlight the `conservative` mode's tendency to overestimate fees compared to the `economical` mode.
- It suggests using the `economical` mode to align fee estimates closer to real-time market conditions.

recent_posts.title: Who will run the CoinJoin coordinators?
recent_posts.summary:

- The setup process is complex but offers a decentralized experience.
- Details on the technology for decentralization are not fully disclosed.

active_posts.title: Silent Payments: Light Client Protocol
active_posts.summary:
- The specification aims to make light clients more efficient by reducing computational and bandwidth demands.
- It introduces a tweak index and cut-through transactions to lessen workload and data transmission.
- Light clients follow a workflow involving fetching tweaks, computing public keys, and matching them against filters to find UTXOs.

active_posts.title: BIP352: PSBT support
active_posts.summary:
- Silent payment and spending in PSBTs focus on enhancing cryptocurrency privacy and security.
- A draft BIP introduces an `OutputGenerator` for streamline silent payment integration.
- The proposal balances advanced features with security implications, aiming for private transactions.

active_posts.title: Tr(): rawnode() and rawleaf() support
active_posts.summary:
- Two new Bitcoin Taproot descriptors, `rawnode(HEXHASH)` and `rawleaf(HEXSCRIPT,[HEXLEAFVER])`, are proposed.
- `rawnode()` allows specifying a Taproot tree branch, enhancing privacy and efficiency.
- `rawleaf()` enables inclusion of raw scripts with different leaf versions, aiding in clearer PSBT communication.

today_in_history_posts.title: BIP 174 thoughts
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Pieter Wuille suggests improvements to the Partially Signed Bitcoin Transaction Format.
- He debates using a key-value map over a set model for reducing PSBT size.
- Proposes canonical form for transactions, optional signer responsibility, and compact PSBT storage.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin scalability aims for 1 billion weekly users with 50,000 off-chain "bitcoin banks."- These entities range from federated sidechains to coinpools, avoiding centralization while enhancing security.
- A hybrid system, integrating Layer 2 protocols and security innovations, could maintain Bitcoin's integrity and scalability.
